title.narrative: UNECA African Climate Policy Centre (ACPC) 2018 - 2019 Short Term Support
UNECA African Climate Policy Centre (ACPC) 2018 - 2019 Short Term Support

description.narrative: The objective of this intervention is maintaining the technical staff for the longterm support by the Embassy in Addis Ababa.

United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA / ACPC) har inkommit med en ansökan om finansiering av total 10 546 440 kr som avser att täcka centrets lönekostnader från juni 2018 till maj 2019. Denna bryggfinansiering avser att bibehålla ACPC personal vilket är centrets viktigaste resurs.
Aktiviteterna som anges i projektdokumentet är redan finansierade från annat håll, t.ex. DfID finansierar programmet Weather and Climate Information SERvices (WISER), Nordiska utvecklingsfonden (NDF) delfinansierar Africa Climate Resilient Investment Facility (AFRI-RES), den norska ambassaden i Etiopien ger generellt programstöd till ACPC. ACPC arbetar med att stödja UNECA:s medlemsländer med policyrelaterad forskning och utveckling samt att bygga kapacitet inom miljö och klimat. Som övergripande mål arbetar de med att stödja nationella processer med att implementera åtaganden under Parisavtalet. Genom denna insats stöder Sida sex tjänster inom ACPC (fem män och en kvinna) med speciell ämneskunskap inom miljö och klimatanpassing som är strategiskt viktiga för ACPC.

United Nations Economic Commission for Africa (UNECA/ACPC) has applied to Sida for funding of 10,546 440 SEK to solve the liquidity challenges associated with the imbalance of resources available for programmatic support Vs related staff costs. Thus, this bridging finance would ensure continuity of programme activities by guaranteeing professional staffs to fully sustain and continue implementation of the already ongoing programme activities, for a period of one year (01 June 2018 to 31 May 2019). The prioritized activities indicated in the project document have already received programmatic support from their respective funding partners, i.e. DfID for the program Weather and Climate Information SERvices (WISER), The Norwegian Development Fund (NDF) providing initial funding support for the Africa Climate Resilient Investment Facility (AFRI-RES) program and the general program support coming from the Royal Norwegian Embassy (Ethiopia).

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: This intervention is unique in a sense that the grant from Sida is used only for staff salary to maintain the technical staff for the preparation of a project document for a long-term support by the Embassy in Addis Ababa. In addition to this the support is also focusing on ensuring continued implementation of ongoing program activities that have already received programmatic support from other funding partners by guaranteeing fully sustenance of professional staff’s contracts for one-year duration. In this regard the short-term support from Sida has ensured both the smooth implementation of ongoing program activities and the preparation of a well thought project document for a long-term financial support which has alrteady been assessed and approved by Sida.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
